intro: Actinophyllum angulatum, commonly known as the angular actinophyllum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, woolly leaves and produces clusters of pale yellow to green flowers. It is typically found in coastal regions and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
